content: this legal text provides an update on a case that has been ongoing for 1 year and 6 months the case involves a coownership property consisting of houses and a yard as well as arable land the parties involved in the coownership are identified as j r and j b f along with other counterparties the civil division has been dissolved and the property will be sold at a public auction with the purchase price distributed according to the size of the coownership shares the applicants request for reimbursement of procedural costs has been rejected the plaintiff filed a motion to dissolve the coownership and the counterparty raised objections regarding the assessment of the propertys value the court ordered evidence from a construction expert to determine the value of the property and the experts findings were deemed substantiated the plaintiff proposed a judicial sale but the counterparty suggested a voluntary transfer which was not achieved therefore the court ordered the dissolution of the coownership and for the parties to reach an agreement on the division method and payment based on their coownership shares the costs of the dissolution proceeding will be borne by the coowners in proportion to their shares except for the plaintiff who proposed dissolution and payment based on undisputed shares and thus will bear the costs solely
